intro: Oldenlandia taborensis, commonly known as the "Cape weed" or "Bishop's weed," is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that are often clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a slightly hairy texture. Oldenlandia taborensis is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
